alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 09 at 4:31AM CDT until July 09 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN OKLAHOMA...CLEVELAND AND POTTAWATOMIE COUNTIES... At 429 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Newalla to 3 miles southwest of Pink to 3 miles northeast of Slaughterville, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Shawnee, Tecumseh, Choctaw, Noble, Harrah, Slaughterville, McLoud, Pink, Tribbey, Wanette, Johnson, St. Louis, Etowah, Brooksville, Macomb, and Stanley Draper Lake. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
